iati-activity.title: Challenges Wordwide:Capacity Building for Justice
iati-activity.description: The pilot study highlighted that inadequate human capacity is one of the most serious problems affecting the justice sector in Malawi. The Capacity Building for Justice Project will therefore seek to build the capacity of public sector institutions and civil society organisations working in Malawi to promote the rule of law and access to justice. It will upgrade the skills of legal professionals in the Ministry of Justice, the Law Commission and the Malawi Law Society as well as a number of NGOs working to enhance the effectiveness of the demand side of justice. The outcomes will be an increase in the number of lawyers and other specialist staff trained in a variety of disciplines. Support for this project will be provided by academia, retired professionals and officials from both the public and private sector in Scotland. It should be noted that all technical assistance provided through this project will be provided on a pro bono basis.
